p: The NBB staining revealed that these structures were protein bodies ( Figure 3A,B). The results of PAS reaction confirmed the presence of carbohydrates located mostly in the cell walls, and no starch grains were detected in the embryo cells ( Figure 3C). The Sudan Black B staining gave a negative result, which indicated the absence of lipid bodies ( Figure 3D). In the plant material treated with the osmium tetroxide solution ( Figure 4A,B), some embryo cells had osmiophilic granules in the cytoplasm, suggesting their lipid character.
